conbody.p: MongoDB destinationCRUD operationTo write to MongoDB, ensure that the CRUD operation record header attribute is defined for each record earlier in the pipeline. Records without an operation record header attribute are sent to error.

Records generated by a CDC-enabled origin include a CRUD operation record header attribute by default. When using data from a non-CDC origin, use an Expression Evaluator or scripting processor in the pipeline to define the record header attribute. For an overview of CDC functionality, see .

To write records to MongoDB, make sure records include one of the following CRUD operation record header attributes:
sdc.operation.type When defined, the MongoDB destination uses the CRUD operation in the sdc.operation.type record header attribute when writing to MongoDB. The MongoDB destination supports the following values for the sdc.operation.type attribute:
1 for INSERT
2 for DELETE
4 for UPSERT
SDC.MONGODB.OPERATION Enabled in an earlier release, the MongoDB destination uses the value set for SDC.MONGODB.OPERATION when the sdc.operation.type attribute is absent or not defined. The destination supports the following values for SDC.MONGODB.OPERATION:
INSERT
UPSERT
DELETE
